CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. 7, reads: "150 Youth Hear Expert Advice on Job Preparation at NAACP Career Confab - Mrs. Springer speaks - Mrs. Maida Springer, business agent of the Ladies International Garment Workers Union of New York City, gave the main address to youth attending last week's career conference, given by the NAACP, at Pitt Student Union Building. Seated at the speaker's table are, left to right: The Rev. R. J. Coleman, Edward Shelton, local NAACP; Herbert Hill, NAACP labor secretary; Eric Springer son of the speaker, and Hugh Cleeland, advisor to the NAACP College Chapter. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Maida Springer Kemp standing and speaking behind head banquet table, with men seated from left: Rev. R. J. Coleman, Edward Shelton, Herbert Hill, Eric Springer, and Hugh Cleeland, at NAACP career conference, University of Pittsburgh Student Union
